content: marled stocking by mackenzie sasser this project uses two colors of worsted-weight yarn held together to make a simple modern stocking materials 120-150 yards each of a main color mc and contrasting color cc worsted weight yarn gauge 3 5 stitches/in gauge not important to project needles size 5mm us 9 dpn additional tools stitch marker blunt tapestry needle pattern using double pointed needles and two stands of mc toe cast on 40 stitches distributing the stitches evenly switch to 2 strands in mc and be sure that your around 4 needles join in the round and work k1 p1 stitches are evenly spaced 9 per needle rib for 10 rounds/2 inches row 1 switch to one strand of each color 1st needle k1 ssk k to end of needle 2nd needle k to last 3 stitches k2tog k1 round 1 repeat for 3rd and 4th needle *k2tog k8 repeat from * to the end of round 36 row 2 k stitches total 9 on each needle row 3 decrease row like row 1 row 4 k knit all stitches for 40 rounds/8 inches repeat decrease row until 12 stitches remain break yarn and run thread through remaining stitches and set up for short row heel pull tight on 2nd and 3rd needle put 12 stitches on for heel 1st needle 6 st 2nd 12 st 3rd 12 st 4th 6 st finishing knit an i-cord 3 inches long and sew to the inside of k6 from first needle begin short row heel with the stocking for a loop two strands of mc working only across the 24 stitches of needles 2 and 3 weave in ends and block short row heel row 1 rs k to last st wrap and turn row 2 ws p to last st w&t row 3 rs k to st before last wrapped st w&t row 4 ws p to st before last wrapped st w&t repeat row 3 and 4 until 12 stitches remain unwrapped between wrapped stitches on either side of the work you will be ready to start a rs row when wrapping sts at turning points of short row which follow note that sts will now have two wraps these stitches will be referred as double wrapped stitches when working a double wrapped stitch on a subsequent row pick up both wraps and work them together w/ the st which had been wrapped row 5 rs k to 1st wrapped st k wrapped st w&t row 6 ws sl 1 p to first wrapped st p wrapped st w&t row 7 rs sl1 k to first double wrapped st k double wrapped st w&t row 8 ws sl 1 p to 1st double wrapped stitch p double wrapped stitch w&t repeat row 7 & 8 until one double wrapped stitch remains at each end of work row 9 rs sl 1 k to double-wrapped stitch k double-wrapped stitch do not turn work drop one strand of mc and knit again
